raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The individual displays a strong preference for high-quality entertainment, indicated by their consistently high ratings (4.1 and above) for various shows and films, especially those with provocative content, such as nudity and violence. They appreciate diverse audio options and subtitles, suggesting a cultural openness and a preference for accessibility in media. 

Common themes in their viewing choices revolve around drama and suspense, often centered on complex narratives involving personal struggles or societal issues. Notably, the user indicates satisfaction with humor in content, as seen in their enthusiastic reviews, underscoring a desire for both emotional depth and lighter moments.

While their rating drops notably for less engaging content, showing a discerning taste, they exhibit moderate price sensitivity, indicated by occasional selection of lower-rated products that still provide basic enjoyment or value. Overall, the individual favors high-production-quality shows and films with emotional or comedic storytelling, while valuing options that enhance the viewing experience across different languages and accessibility features.

target_interaction.title: Boring
description: Faith thinks she is leaving her abusive relationship behind when she moves in with Lola on her family farm. Each night when the girls go out, Lola comes home with a man. When Faith realizes these men never make it off the farm, she starts to believe Lola's family might be killing more than just animals in the slaughterhouse.
